channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Female founders are optimistic that AI could solve challenges they face funding and scaling startups
item.description: Fifty-six percent of female founders say they see more opportunity because of AI.

item.title: How CFOs and CMOs can team up to drive long-term growth
item.description: Marketing has slid to the back seat at many companies, according to McKinsey research.

item.title: 25-year-old who delivered donuts to Silicon Valley bosses with his resume hidden inside is going viral as Gen Z is desperate for job-hunting hacks
item.description: With millions of Gen Zers unemployed and AI killing entry-level jobs, one creative resume hack from 2016 is going viral again.

item.title: Crypto VCs were once an exotic species—now they’re part of the tech ecosystem
item.description: While some obvious differences remain, crypto investing now feels like just another stream in venture.

item.title: Greenhouse unveils a new tool that makes the job search feel more like a dating app
item.description: The HR company wants candidates to mark certain applications as the “Dream Jobs.”

item.title: CarMax shares rallying as Trump’s tariffs are fueling used-car demand
Stock futures pop as report suggests Iran is ready to discuss enrichment limits
His SPACs lost billions for investors. He’s getting ready to try again.
The S&P 500 will ride out the Israel-Iran crisis. Stay invested, says Citi
Economic calendar: Leading indicators and factory data cap the week’s reports
